text:
Morning!
I want to create a custom form and according to the docs I can copy the existing form module, but how and where? The boilerplate contains only the forms.css - no form module of sorts.
I was on my way there just now :smile: Self-rubber -ducking ftw

<@UBT0AHWLD> Do you happen to know if it's possible to add for example a text or image within the form?
Even with a cloned form module the .html is using the "built in" `{% form %}`
i guess you would need to create your own form and send the data via API in this case
however i am quite certain that you can add a image via the UI in the form editor
at least using a RichText field ( dont know if there is a custom Image field available of the top of my head right now.

Was afraid so yea.
You can indeed add images; was a poor example :+1:
Had more custom radio buttons/checkboxes in mind.
Thanks
Reminder: You can create a theme starting from the boilerplate a few different ways. Learn how <https://youtu.be/gBMaBD4G0fM>

Question regarding the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates#global-partials|global partial> function. When using this, it seems to wrap the content in a wrapper, for example:
```<div data-global-resource-path="/templates/partials/header.html">...</div>```
Is there anyway to remove this wrapper? I've tried adding `no_wrapper=True` as an attribute, but this doesn't seem to do anything.

Thanks!
